results.title: Take a look 2
results.creator_credit: Milton van der Veen and TV Ontario
results.brief_description: Set in the country, this series takes a hands-on approach to the principles of science. Kate returns in this series with a new friend, Jamie, and together they explore the natural environment. Kate teaches Jamie about plant and animal life, basic astronomy, geology and meteorology. They experiment with household items and investigate the principles that underly everyday occurrences.

results.title: Take a letter, please
results.brief_description: Shows amusingly how bad dictation destroys stenographers’ morale and wastes valuable office hours. Burlesques the common faults of people who dictate letters, such as: The scatterbrain who isn’t prepared, the speed demon, the dreamer, Mr Mumblemush and Simon Legree. Concludes with a demonstration of the correct method to dictate a letter using a dictagraph machine.

results.title: Take a deep deadly breath. Part III
results.creator_credit: Philip Burton, James Benjamin and ABC News (US)
results.brief_description: Initially, the film seeks to make us aware of the constant danger of being contaminated by poisoned air when we are breathing. Secondly, it seeks to make us realise that the problem of chemical fallout is being neglected and getting worse. Part 3’s theme is “How can we get clean air?” and points out that three out of five Americans breathe dangerously polluted air while the list of polluted cities grows.

results.title: Take a deep deadly breath. Part II
results.creator_credit: Philip Burton, James Benjamin and ABC News (US)
results.brief_description: Initially, the film seeks to make us aware of the constant danger of being contaminated by poisoned air when we are breathing. Secondly, it seeks to make us realise that the problem of chemical fallout is being neglected and getting worse. Part 2 deals with the efforts of an American community to cope with the problem of air pollution.

results.title: Tahiti: pacific cocktail
results.creator_credit: John Gray, Ivan Chapman, Neil Edwards and Australian Broadcasting Commission

results.title: Tahere Tikitiki: the making of a Maori canoe
results.creator_credit: David H. Fowler and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Follows the building of a Maori canoe, picturing the lives of the men who make the canoe while relating the symbolic elements of Maori culture which enter into the activity.

results.title: TAFE: many different things
results.brief_description: To inform viewers in rural areas that TAFE is providing a real alternative to conventional schooling. Looks at five people of varying ages from student to housewife, and having two things in common - a rural association and involvement in TAFE courses.

results.title: Tad the frog
results.brief_description: Follows the development of a frog through the egg, tadpole, and adult stages. Shows the eating habits of frogs; how they breathe, grow, and live. Instills ideas on pet care and conservation of wildlife.
